executive_summary: The Office Stationery Wholesaling industry has contended with a long-term decline in demand. Demand for office stationery has fallen alongside a rise in digitization, in which businesses, retailers and individuals are swapping out pen and paper for their digital counterparts... Revenue is expected to decline at a CAGR of 2.7% to $44.7 billion over the five years to 2024, including a 0.8% increase in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Rise of Digital Has Diminished the Need for Stationery
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Growing dependence on computers and other electronic equipment in homes and offices has decreased the need for stationery, constraining demand from individuals and businesses.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Office-based work has declined since the COVID-19 pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In an effort to control the spread of COVID-19, many businesses and schools temporarily shut down in order to follow social distancing guidelines.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Declining demand has forced remaining wholesalers to reorient
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increasing internal competition has led industry operators to consolidate through mergers and acquisitions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: CONSUMPTION PATTERNS WILL MOVE FURTHER TOWARD DIGITAL MEDIUMS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Digitalization will continue to shift consumer preferences away from stationery products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE FUTURE OF WORK WILL DETERMINE THE FATE OF STATIONERY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: More companies will embrace flexible remote policies, reducing demand for office equipment in traditional workspaces.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A DIMINISHED MARKET WILL PROMPT CHANGE ACROSS THE INDUSTRY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Manufacturers and wholesalers will likely focus on forms of stationery made from higher-value grades of specialty or recycled paper.

industry_definition: Industry operators distribute a range of paper stationery products and other office supplies to retailers, other wholesalers, foreign buyers, and directly to customers.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: COVID-19 has accelerated digitalization across the economy.
Remote and hybrid work policies will continue to reduce the need for office stationery.
An increase in business conducted online has hindered sales of office stationery.
Office stationery wholesalers must adhere to patent and trademark rules.
Digitalization has curbed demand for paper stationery products.
Online sales have undercut demand from office supply retailers.
The Southeast, West, Mid-Atlantic and Great Lakes regions are home to more than 70.0% of all office stationery wholesalers.
Wholesalers compete on their ability to serve as a one-stop shop.
Office stationery wholesaling is highly fragmented.
The largest stationery wholesalers have seen their positions deteriorate.
Office supply wholesalers face declining profitability.
Wholesalers have slashed wages in an effort to bolster profit.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Stationery products, like printing paper and envelopes, are vital to the day-to-day operations of all businesses.
Other wholesalers purchase a variety of products from specialized wholesalers.
Retailers are a vital link in the sale and distribution of office stationery products.
Other Industries in this segment include manufacturing, restaurants, hotels, and household consumers.
Federal, state and local governments provide a steady customer base for office stationery wholesalers.

tier_2_suppliers: Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US
Gift Shops & Card Stores in the US
tier_2_buyers: Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US
Office Supply Stores in the US
Professional, Scientific and Technical Services in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Remote Work Arrangements Will Hasten the Demise of Stationery, Tablets and Office Paper
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Stationery products include office and consumer paper products. The increasing use of digital technology to communicate has decreased the need for stationery.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Use of Business Forms Has Diminished in a Changing Economy
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Business forms include printed invoices, financial statements, and compensation forms. Online services reduce the need for paper business forms.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Toner and Toner Cartridges are Increasingly a Thing of the Past
demand_determinants.determinant_description: As interoffice communication can now be conducted electronically, the need for toner has decreased.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Envelopes, Labels, Writing Instruments and Other Products
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The need for envelopes and labels has fallen due to the shift towards digital communication.

business_locations.location_description: Wholesalers benefit from reduced shipping expenses from the high percentage of stationery manufacturers.
Similar to office stationery manufacturers, most establishments are located in California.
Despite closures, this region has a concentrated consumer population and many manufacturing plants.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Wholesalers must comply with laws protecting intellectual property rights.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: Ensure employees' safe and healthy working conditions.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in the decline stage, indicating moderate barriers to entry.
There is no industry assistance, keeping barriers steady.
High and increasing competition creates moderate barriers to entry.

factors_decreased_barrier: The industry has low revenue volatility.
The industry has low capital intensity.
The industry has low market concentration.
The industry is experiencing increasing globalization.

basis_points.basis_description: Wholesalers compete heavily on price as downstream retailers want to pay the lowest possible price.
Wholesalers compete on their ability to serve as a one-stop shop.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Wholesalers spread across many locations close to markets.
Decreasing demand and intensified competition have impacted industry players.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The cost of industry purchases fluctuates only marginally each year.
Wage costs have decreased as a share of revenue.
Profit has consistently fallen over the period.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Employees with required skill sets are easier to find.
Low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur.
High concentration suggests exposure to unforeseen innovations.
Market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified.

volatility_points.volatility_description: As more of the economy shifts to digital operations.
Stationery is used across the whole economy.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Remote work arrangements will hasten the demise
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Increasing use of digital technology has diminished the need.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The use of business forms has diminished
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Increasing use of online services reduces need.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Toner and toner cartridges are increasingly a thing of the past
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Interoffice communication can now be conducted electronically.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Envelopes, labels, writing instruments and other products
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The need for these has fallen significantly.

FAQs.question: What assistance does the Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA) provide to the industry?
FAQs.answer: The OSHA sets regulations and standards to ensure employees' safe and healthy working conditions.

FAQs.question: How have sales been affected by the growth of online shopping?
FAQs.answer: Companies have suffered from the increasing percentage of services conducted online.

FAQs.question: How do shifts in consumer preferences toward digitalization and sustainability affect business performance?
FAQs.answer: Increasing environmental consciousness among individuals has negatively influenced the industry.

FAQs.question: Has the company explored growth opportunities via mergers or acquisitions?
FAQs.answer: Mergers and acquisitions have increased as larger companies acquire smaller companies.

FAQs.question: How does the company negotiate favorable purchase costs with suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Large companies negotiate lower prices by having good relationships with manufacturers.

FAQs.question: Does the company use RFID to optimize inventory management and improve efficiency?
FAQs.answer: RFID-based product inventory is automatically generated through geolocation.

FAQs.question: How has the company implemented technology into the purchasing process?
FAQs.answer: Many orders are now undertaken through internet-based systems.

FAQs.question: Is the company subject to environmental regulations?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers must abide by certain pollution regulations monitored by the EPA.

FAQs.question: How does the company ensure relevant health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies work with associations to stay updated on relevant regulations.

FAQs.question: What cost-saving measures does the company employ?
FAQs.answer: Companies have cut their workforce and closed underperforming facilities.

FAQs.question: How do the company's profit margins compare to competitors?
FAQs.answer: Average profit margins grow due to implementing cost-saving measures.

FAQs.question: Does the company provide after-sales advice and generate revenue through accessory sales?
FAQs.answer: Good response times to clients' needs gain a competitive edge.

FAQs.question: Has the company invested in automation and what effect does it have on profits?
FAQs.answer: Automation improves efficiency and reduces costs, providing an advantage.

FAQs.question: Does the company have contacts with key distributors and end users? Is it located close to markets and suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Business relationships are necessary for continuous demand.

FAQs.question: How has the rising internet penetration affected demand for products?
FAQs.answer: The internet reduces demand for stationery products.

FAQs.question: How does the company monitor corporate profit and its effect on demand?
FAQs.answer: Corporate profit loss typically leads companies to reduce expenditures.

FAQs.question: How do higher consumer spending levels affect revenue and demand stimulation?
FAQs.answer: Increased consumer spending positively affects stationery purchases.
